intro: Ischaemum stolzii, commonly known as the Stolz's beakgrass, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the grass family Poaceae and is characterized by its slender, erect stems and narrow, linear leaves. The plant produces small, spike-like inflorescences that bear tiny, wind-pollinated flowers. Ischaemum stolzii is typically found in dry, open habitats such as grasslands and rocky areas. Its botanical features make it an important component of the local flora and a subject of ecological study.
